text: Ebru Kavaklıoğlu (born Yelena Kopytova on 14 March 1970 in the Russian SFSR) is a retired long-distance runner who specialized mainly in the 5000 metres. She initially represented Russia, but became a Turkish citizen by marriage in 1999, changing her name at the same time. She was member of the Fenerbahçe Athletics Club. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |6th |3000 m |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |11th |3000 m |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1999 |World Championships |Seville, Spain |5th |5000 m |- |rowspan=2 | 2001 |rowspan=2 | Mediterranean Games |rowspan=2 | Radès, Tunisia |bgcolor="cc9966" align="center" | 3rd |1500 m |- |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |5000 m |} ===Personal bests=== *1500 metres - 4:08.45 min (1999) *5000 metres - 14:51.69 min (1999) ==External links== * Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Russian female long- distance runners Category:Fenerbahçe athletes Category:Naturalized citizens of Turkey Category:Turkish people of Russian descent Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of the Unified Team Category:Olympic athletes of Turkey Category:Turkish female long-distance runners Category:Russian emigrants to Turkey Category:Mediterranean Games gold medalists for Turkey Category:Mediterranean Games bronze medalists for Turkey Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in athletics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2001 Mediterranean Games
title: Ebru Kavaklıoğlu
